alert.note: Alert for Cheshire (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 4:27PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Cheshire County through 500 PM EDT... At 427 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Swanzey, or 8 miles south of Keene, moving south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Swanzey, Winchester, Fitzwilliam, Richmond, Troy, Marlborough, Chesterfield and Hinsdale. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
